attributes.action: Ban all schools from not allowing students to use the toilet
attributes.additional_details: Article 11 of the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights or ICESCR says The right to sanitation is an element of "the right of everyone to an adequate standard of living for himself and his family".
attributes.background: Most secondary schools only allow children  to use the toilet if they have medical needs. But what if a child has medical needs but they don't know? Medical needs or not, holding a pee-- or a poo, for too long is bad for your bladder.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions, which call for a similar action:

Require schools to allow students to have access to the toilet during lessons:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/643422

Give students a legal right to access school toilets when they have their period:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/637669

We also cannot publish petitions that do not include a full name.
